bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, May 16, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: ACKNOWLEDGED file JUNE 29 1901 Bureau of Foreign Commerce

div1.p: No. 70. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, May 16, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Increased facilities of transportation between Liverpool and Monrovia.
Synopsis. The British and African Steam Navigation Co; and the African Steamship Company, have so amended their schedules as to give Monrovia seven Steamers per month; each being mail from Liverpool.
No. 70. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; May 16, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence that the West African trade has so increased in volume, coupled with the prospect of the South African trade as to induce The Elder, Dumpster Co. of Liverpool, to run seven steamers to Monrovia monthly, each being mail matter, and four calling only for the mails and Kroo Bays. I have the honor to be yours &c &c. Owen L. W. Smith, C. G. Inclosures, Schedules.

TOURIST'S TICKETS, SALOON (available for Twelve Months) are issued from LIVERPOOL to MADEIRA TENERIFFE, and GRAND CANARY, for £15, giving Tourists the privilege of visiting these Islands, with the option of returning from GRAND CANARY to GENOA or BAROELONA by the magnificent steamers of LA VELOCE NAVIGAZIONE ITALIANA A VAPORE.
Madeira, Teneriffe, Grand Canary, & the West and South-West Coasts of Africa. THE AFRICAN STEAMSHIP COMPANY.
INCORPORATED BY ROYAL CHARTER. (UNDER CONTRACT FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF HER MAJESTY'S MAILS.) LOADING BERTH, SOUTH WEST SIDE BRUNSWICK DOCK.

Shippers are respectfully informed that the Royal Mail Steamships will be despatched from Liverpool as under-- (Unless prevented by unforeseen circumstances.)
SAILING DATE. NAME. PORTS Last day for receiving cargo, if not previously full. Tender leaves Prince's Landing Stage.

May 4th NIGER {Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Goree, Dakar, Rufisque, Bathurst, Sierra Leone, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Grand Bassam, Assinie, Half Assinie, Axim, Cape Coast Castle, Accra, *Lagos Roads, Bonny, New Calabar, Opobo.} 6 p.m., May 2nd 10 a.m., May 4th May 9th BENIN {Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, *Sierra Leone, Sherbro, Cape Mount, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Cape Palmas, Sinoe, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Lahou, Axim, Dixcove, Sekondi, Chama, Elmina, Anamaboe, Appam, Winnebah, *Accra, Pram Pram, Little Popo, Grand Popo, and Bey Beach.} 6p.m., May 7th 10a.m., May 9th May 25thANGOLA{Madeira, Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, Sierra Leone, Kroo Coast, Sekondi, Cape Coast Castle, Salt Pond, Accra, Addah, Quittah, Kotoneu, *Lagos Roads, Forcados, Benin, Sepelli, Warree, Burutu, Akassa and Brass.} 6 p.m., May 23rd 10 a.m., May 25th
